intro: Aethionema membranaceum, commonly known as the Armenian carnation, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus and Central Asia. It is a low-growing perennial that produces small, showy flowers in shades of pink, white, and purple. The plant has hairy, succulent leaves that help it retain moisture in its arid habitat. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar floral structures. Aethionema membranaceum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in rock gardens and alpine settings.
